decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing the combo potential of Nadu, Winged Wisdom, along with Nomads en-Kor, to create a powerful synergy. The deck includes various control elements such as Swords to Plowshares, Force of Will, and Teferi, Time Raveler to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Green Sun's Zenith and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional consistency and card advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the combo and control elements, allowing the deck to efficiently execute its game plan and outmaneuver the opponent.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through Cloudpost lands and Glimmerposts, allowing you to play powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms ahead of schedule. It also utilizes Chalice of the Void to disrupt opposing strategies and protect your own game plan. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of mana advantage and powerful spells, while also having some control elements like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect your key pieces.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Cloudpost and Ancient Tomb to cast powerful spells like Karn, the Great Creator, Ugin, Eye of the Storms, and The One Ring. While utilizing Force of Will and Chalice of the Void for disruption, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble its combo pieces for a big finish. With access to various utility spells and a strong late-game plan, this deck aims to overwhelm its opponent with a mix of power and control in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo between Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill out the opponent's library and win the game. It also includes various support cards like Urza's Saga, Emry, Lurker of the Loch, and Mishra's Bauble to help set up the combo efficiently. Additionally, cards like Force of Will and Metallic Rebuke provide protection and disruption against opposing strategies. The deck aims to control the game and assemble the combo pieces quickly to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on using lands to control the game, with cards like Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths to create powerful token creatures. The deck also utilizes cards like Exploration and Life from the Loam to ramp up mana production and control the opponent's resources with cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter. Boseiju, Who Endures and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale provide additional control options, while Mox Diamond and Once Upon a Time help to ensure a steady flow of resources. This deck aims to outlast opponents and control the game through land manipulation and resource denial.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana and play multiple spells in a single turn to build up a storm count. The key cards in the deck enable the player to draw cards, disrupt the opponent's hand, and ramp up mana production. By chaining together spells like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, and Rite of Flame, the player can eventually cast Tendrils of Agony to finish off the opponent in one massive combo turn. The deck also includes tools like Wishclaw Talisman and Duress to help find key pieces and deal with disruption from the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with key creatures using spells like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then reanimate them using cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes countermagic like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker and Brazen Borrower helps to control the board while progressing towards the combo win condition. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently reanimate powerful creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing low mana cost spells and creatures to quickly overwhelm opponents with aggressive plays. This involves generating card advantage through cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm, while also disrupting opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck's key win conditions are tempo-based threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The mana base includes fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the deck's limited color requirements.

The main concept of this deck is to play aggressively and quickly, utilizing cards like Seasoned Dungeoneer, Caves of Chaos Adventurer, and Undermountain Adventurer to establish board presence early on. By including cards like Magus of the Moon and Archon of Emeria, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and slow down their ability to respond. The mana acceleration provided by Lotus Petal, Elvish Spirit Guide, and Simian Spirit Guide allows for explosive plays, while cards like Chancellor of the Annex and Trinisphere help to control the game and limit the opponent's options. The inclusion of Chrome Mox and Sarevok's Tome provide additional utility and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing cards like Mystic Forge and Manifold Key to generate card advantage and mana ramp, while also using Urza's Workshop to cast powerful artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain. The goal is to establish a board presence quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of combo pieces and disruptive elements like Tormod's Crypt and Portable Hole, ultimately leading to victory through a well-executed combo strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Dark Ritual and Lion's Eye Diamond, and then cast multiple spells in a single turn to build up storm count. This allows the player to generate a large amount of storm and eventually win the game with cards like Tendrils of Agony or through the Burning Wish sideboard package. The deck also includes disruption and protection spells like Veil of Summer and Silence to help ensure the combo can go off successfully.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Swords to Plowshares, along with card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brainstorm. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually gaining incremental advantage to eventually overwhelm them. The deck also includes threats like Murktide Regent and Snapcaster Mage to pressure the opponent while maintaining control of the game. Mana consistency is achieved through a well-balanced mana base consisting of fetch lands and dual lands.

The main idea of this deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly through aggressive creatures like Magus of the Moon and Fury, while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Blood Moon. The deck aims to control the board and limit the opponent's options, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful creatures like Pyrogoyf and Sundering Eruption. The strategy revolves around ramping up mana quickly with cards like Chrome Mox and City of Traitors to play high impact threats and spells early in the game, dictating the pace of the match.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient spells while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and land destruction. The deck aims to apply pressure early in the game with cards like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while also controlling the board with cards like Force of Will and Wasteland. By combining aggressive creatures and disruption spells, the deck seeks to maintain tempo and prevent the opponent from executing their own strategy effectively.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of card draw and removal spells, while also having access to powerful creatures with unique abilities. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal, while also establishing a threatening board presence with cards like Quantum Riddler and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck's mana base is primarily made up of blue and white lands, with some green sources for additional versatility. Overall, the deck is designed to outlast and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of control elements and powerful creatures.

The deck focuses on assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo, using cards like Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill the library, then using Dread Return to reanimate Thassa's Oracle for a win. The deck also includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo. Additionally, cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Urza's Saga provide card advantage and support. The main goal is to quickly assemble the combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.
